question.title: Swagger Editor shows multiple "Structural error at [path] should have required property 'description' missingProperty: description"
question.body:
So I have a bunch of these errors in the title when I try to put my generated openapi.json in the Swagger Editor. Since I don't want to write any description where the description is required and there are a LOT of them, I figured I could automate this by grabbing all the missing descriptions and add a "" or " " to make the errors go away.

Although when I manually type description = "" in the editor where it points me, when I put the same thing in my java code the description = "" doesn't appear at all in the resulting json.

The way I tried to solve this is by implementing ContainerReponseFilter registrating it on my ResourceConfig.

public class SwaggerBlankDescriptionFilter implements ContainerResponseFilter {
@Override
public void filter(ContainerRequestContext request, COntainerResponseContext response)
throws IOException {
if (response.getEntity() instanceof Operation operation){
        for(ApiResponse apiResponse: operation.getResponses().values()){
            if(apiResponse.getDescription().isEmpty()){
                apiResponse.setDescription("")
            }
        }
    }
}

}

Why I'm trying like this is because the missing descriptions should be located at @Operation(... responses = @ApiResponse()) in the @ApiResponse

Even if I try to catch a specific value in my filter method rather than a Empty I'm still unable to alter the description field.

How can I make this work?

answers.body: One option is to adjust the ruleset you use with Swagger Editor, so that it doesn't require the description fields. This isn't a required field in OpenAPI, but it's very much recommended which is why most editors/linters will give the feedback that it should exist.

79598484.body: In postman I get only incorrect format error, nothing more.I'm unable to import the collection. I think that these two suggestions won't work for me. I want to dynamically populate the descriptions before my collection is generated, not to edit them via ci/cd

OK, I think I understand the problem better. Are you sure that Postman fails with the same error? As I say, descriptions aren't a required field for OpenAPI. If you have summary fields, you could use a custom plugin tool to adjust your OpenAPI file after generating it and before uploading it. Other options: use an Overlay to add descriptions to every operation, or try adding an annotation to your code that isn't empty.

If I got it right that would only make the errors disappear on the swagger editor? What I want is to modify the generated openapi.json because right now when it's imported in postman it fails due to a error while parsing the file. Thats what I'm interested in, I'm only using the editor so I can see the parsing errors.
